subsection.content: Any person who knowingly makes a false report, or furnishes any false or misleading information, to a member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer in performing his duties under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Any person, who, in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the grant of a permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document or other article (howsoever described) required under this Ordinance (including required under a permit or under the Convention) to be provided to the Commissioner, the Director, a member of the Customs and Excise Service, an authorized officer, or an inspection team,

subsection.continued: makes or causes to be made any statement or furnishes or causes to be furnished any information which is false or misleading in a material particular or omits any material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years, unless he satisfies the court that he did not know and had no reason to believe the statement or information to be false or misleading or the omission to be material.

subsection.content: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails to provide a document or other article in accordance with a requirement referred to in subsection (1)(b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Time limitation for criminal proceedings
section.content: In any case of an offence, other than an indictable offence, under this Ordinance, a complaint shall be made or an information laid in respect of the offence within 2 years or, in the case of an offence under section 35(2), 3 years from the time when the matter of the complaint or information, as the case may be, arose.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of, or the applicant for, a permit to which a relevant decision applies may appeal in writing to the Chief Executive in Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: against the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 28 days after notice of the decision was served on the holder or the applicant, as the case may be.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), relevant decision (有關決定) means a decision of the Director to which section 10(4) applies.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council shall determine an appeal under subsection (1) by confirming, varying or reversing the decision the subject of the appeal.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Power of Director to specify forms

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Director may specify the form of any document required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form and the form of such other documents required for the purposes of this Ordinance as he thinks fit.

The Director’s power under subsection (1) shall be subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form, whether specified or otherwise, to comply with that requirement, but that requirement shall not restrict the exercise of that power in respect of that form to the extent that, in the opinion of the Director, his exercise of that power in respect of that form does not contravene that requirement.

subsection.leadIn: The Director’s power under subsection (1) may be exercised in such a way as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include in the specified form of any document referred to in that subsection a statutory declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be made by the person completing the form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of that person’s knowledge and belief;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify 2 or more forms of any document referred to in that subsection, whether as alternatives, or to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases, as the Director thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with such directions and instructions as are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such documents as are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the completed form is required to be provided to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person on behalf of the Director; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other person,

paragraph.continued: so provided in the manner and within the period, if any, specified in the form.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may by order amend Schedule 1, 2 or 3 in order to effect changes made to the Convention under Article XV of the Convention. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)
The Financial Secretary may by order amend Schedule 4.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Service of notices
section.leadIn: Subject to section 21(6) and (10), a notice (howsoever described) which is required to be served under this Ordinance, or which may be served under this Ordinance, on a person (howsoever described) shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to be so served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to him;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at his last known address for service, or at his last known place of residence or business, in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by post to him at his last known address for service, or at his last known postal address, in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by telex, facsimile transmission or other similar method to him at his last known address for service, or at his last known postal address, or at his last known place of residence or business, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: given to or served on an officer of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at the company’s last known address for service, or at its last known place of business, in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by post to the company at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, in Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by telex, facsimile transmission or other similar method to the company at its last known address for service, or at its last known postal address, or at its last known place of business, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partnership, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) in respect of any partner who is an individual; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: given, served, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) in respect of any partner which is a company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person (attorney) holding a power of attorney under which the attorney is authorized to accept service in respect of another person, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) where the attorney is an individual;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: given, served, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) where the attorney is a company;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: delivered, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (a) in respect of any partner who is an individual where the attorney is a partnership; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: given, served, left or sent in accordance with paragraph (b) in respect of any partner which is a company where the attorney is a partnership.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations prescribing matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: required or permitted by this Ordinance to be prescribed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: necessary or convenient to be prescribed for carrying out or giving effect to this Ordinance,

section.continued: and, in particular, making provision with respect to—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the making of reports to the Organization in compliance with Hong Kong’s obligations under the Convention;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: offences in respect of contraventions of the regulations including the imposition in respect of any such offence of a fine not exceeding level 6 and of imprisonment for a period not exceeding 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: Where on the relevant day the operator of a facility requires a permit to operate the facility during the year in which that day falls, then the operator shall be deemed to be the holder of a permit to operate the facility during that year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), until the expiration of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 3 months immediately following that day; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that year,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an application is made under section 9—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a permit to operate the facility during that year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before whichever expiration referred to in paragraph (a) first occurs,

paragraph.continued: until the determination under section 10 of the application.

subsection.leadIn: Where the relevant day falls after 30 September in a year, then the operator of a facility who requires a permit to operate the facility during the immediately following year shall be deemed to be the holder of a permit to operate the facility during that immediately following year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), until the expiration of 3 months immediately following that day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an application is made under section 9—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a permit to operate the facility during that immediately following year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before the expiration referred to in paragraph (a) occurs,

paragraph.continued: until the determination under section 10 of the application.

subsection.def: In this section, relevant day (有關日期) means the day on which section 8 commences*.
